intro: Phyllanthodendron anthopotamicum, commonly known as the Brazilian star apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by fleshy, reddish berries that are edible. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
